body.p: The 2018 Conceptual Framework explains that if rights are available to all other parties without significant cost, those rights are typically not assets for the entities that hold them. The Board included this explanation in the 2018 Conceptual Framework to clarify that defining an asset as a right would not compel entities to identify and recognise as assets their holdings of a possibly large array of rights.
